a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Reported cases of acute African trypanosomiasis
The number of reported cases of acute African trypanosomiasis (sleeping sickness). The disease is caused by
parasites that are spread by tsetse flies and other insects. The disease is typically fatal if not treated.
Data source: World Health Organization - Global Health Observatory (2024)
Note: Reported case numbers are limited by surveillance capacity.
